name: Goblin War Cry
text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Goblins cry, soldiers fly.
Stones fly, soldiers die!"

name: Goblin Wardriver
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren

name: Goblin War Drums
text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

"The Goblins' dreaded War Drums struck terror into the hearts of even their bravest foes."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
The War Drums enabled Goblin and Orcish armies to crush the sparsely defended Dwarven cities.

"Defending the outer trenches, we strained our eyes in the darkness. All we could hear was the Drums' terrible pounding. Dobbs, on my right, broke first. Soon, we were all heading for the walls."
—Corporal Peter Douglas, courtmartial testimony

When creating a new War Drum, Goblin designers sought out the highest quality skulls. Serra Angel skulls were most highly prized, although most acknowledged that the skull of the exotic Sea Serpent made for a richer tone.

name: Goblin War Paint
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.

editions.flavor:
"The secret to our war paint is hot peppers and stinkbugs. Lots of stinkbugs."
—Skab, goblin secretkeeper
War paint made from kolya fruit heightens senses and lessens fear. Unfortunately, fear is usually what keeps you alive.
"The Eldrazi may not be intimidated, but if it boosts the goblins' confidence, I see no reason to discourage it."—Jalun, Affa sentry
War paint made from kolya fruit heightens senses and lessens fear. Unfortunately, fear is usually what keeps you alive.

name: Goblin Warrens
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

editions.flavor: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

name: Goblin War Strike
text: Goblin War Strike deals damage equal to the number of Goblins you control to target player.

editions.flavor: "Fire, aim, ready!"

name: Goblin War Wagon
text:
Goblin War Wagon doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}. If you do, untap Goblin War Wagon.

name: Goblin Welder
text: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."
"I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."
"I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."

name: Goblin Wizard
text:
{T}: You may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
{R}: Target Goblin gains protection from white until end of turn.

name: God-Favored General
text: Inspired — Whenever God-Favored General becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, create two 1/1 white Soldier enchantment creature tokens.

editions.flavor: Someone had to be first to attack, but he was not alone for long.

name: Godhead of Awe
text:
Flying
Other creatures have base power and toughness 1/1.

editions.flavor:
"What she saw crawling upon this world repulsed her. Yet she could not tear her gaze away."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Godhunter Octopus
text: Godhunter Octopus can't attack unless defending player controls an enchantment or an enchanted permanent.

editions.flavor:
"I will match Thassa drop for drop and show a god what true power is."
—Kiora

name: Godless Shrine
text:
({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)
As Godless Shrine enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Godless Shrine enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Judgment without hope.

name: Godo, Bandit Warlord
text:
When Godo, Bandit Warlord enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Equipment card and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
Whenever Godo attacks for the first time each turn, untap it and all Samurai you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

name: Godo's Irregulars
text: {R}: Godo's Irregulars deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.

editions.flavor: Godo trained their muscles and honed their skills, but he left their hearts wild and empty.

name: Godsend
text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+3.
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by one or more creatures, you may exile one of those creatures.
Opponents can't cast cards with the same name as cards exiled with Godsend.
Equip {3}

name: Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
When Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token.

editions.flavor: Listen at its walls and you will hear the whispers of gods.

name: Godsire
text:
Vigilance
{T}: Create an 8/8 Beast creature token that's red, green, and white.

editions.flavor:
"Lay sacrifice to the godsire that it may spare us, but save some for his progeny who also will hunger."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher

name: Gods Willing
text: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: Honor the gods of Theros, and they will return the favor.
Honor the gods of Theros, and they will return the favor.

name: Godtoucher
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature with power 5 or greater this turn.

editions.flavor: "Gargantuans die not in moments but in moons. There is still time to aid this noble ancient."

name: Godtracker of Jund
text: Whenever a creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Godtracker of Jund.

editions.flavor: "The behemoths are content to graze like cattle, while dragons rage and conquer. I know which example I'll follow."

name: Go for the Throat
text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.

editions.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.
Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

name: Goham Djinn
text:
{1}{B}: Regenerate Goham Djinn.
Goham Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as black is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

name: Goka the Unjust
text: {T}: Goka the Unjust deals 4 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

editions.flavor: The elvish scout was scrupulous about the truth. She told the traders that gold lay nearby.

name: Goldenglow Moth
text:
Flying
Whenever Goldenglow Moth blocks, you may gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: Ordinary moths follow it, drawn to its light.

"Little moth, fluttering bright,
What luck will you bring tonight?"
—Benalish children's rhyme

name: Goldenhide Ox
text: Constellation — Whenever Goldenhide Ox or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature must be blocked this turn if able.

editions.flavor: The temptation to take the ox's golden hide is as irresistible as it is fatal.

name: Golden Hind
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"It is not yours to hunt, mortal. Be content with its beauty alone."
—Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Golden Urn
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Golden Urn.
{T}, Sacrifice Golden Urn: You gain life equal to the number of charge counters on Golden Urn.

name: Golden Wish
text: You may choose an artifact or enchantment card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Golden Wish.

editions.flavor: She wished for nobility, but not for a nation to honor it.

name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.
Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.

name: Goldmeadow
text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield, that land's controller creates three 0/1 white Goat creature tokens.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, create a 0/1 white Goat creature token.

name: Goldmeadow Dodger
text: Goldmeadow Dodger can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.

editions.flavor: "I've gotten close enough to a giant to smell his breath, but none has ever so much as spotted me. I wonder how long my record can extend?"

name: Goldmeadow Harrier
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor:
"It's a proven fact that sling-stones from the dawn side of the riverbank sail the farthest and truest."
—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

"It's a proven fact that sling-stones from the dawn side of the riverbank sail the farthest and truest."
—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

name: Goldmeadow Lookout
text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token named Goldmeadow Harrier. It has "{W}, {T}: Tap target creature."

name: Goldmeadow Stalwart
text: As an additional cost to cast Goldmeadow Stalwart, reveal a Kithkin card from your hand or pay {3}.

editions.flavor: The thoughtweft ties a clachan together. Sharing each other's hopes and fears, all the village's citizens spring into action upon the first threat to any one of them.

name: Gold Myr
text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.
The myr are like razorgrass: numberless metal figures, reflecting each other's light.
The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.

name: Goldnight Castigator
text:
Flying, haste
If a source would deal damage to you, it deals double that damage to you instead.
If a source would deal damage to Goldnight Castigator, it deals double that damage to Goldnight Castigator instead.

name: Goldnight Commander
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "One faith, but many hands in victory."

name: Goldnight Redeemer
text:
Flying
When Goldnight Redeemer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each other creature you control.

editions.flavor: The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering.
The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering.

name: Golem Artisan
text:
{2}: Target artifact creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{2}: Target artifact creature gains your choice of flying, trample, or haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Better living through metallurgy.

name: Golem Foundry
text:
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may put a charge counter on Golem Foundry.
Remove three charge counters from Golem Foundry: Create a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token.

name: Golem's Heart
text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The heart of a golem gives life to more than just the iron husk around it.
The heart of a golem gives life to more than just the iron husk around it.

text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each Equipment attached to it.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

text:
When Golgari Brownscale is put into your hand from your graveyard, you gain 2 life.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Golgari Charm
text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"Let the rest of Ravnica sneer. One way or another, they all end up in the undercity."

name: Golgari Cluestone
text:
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Golgari Cluestone: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Golgari mold collects whispers, intelligence that is later harvested by Jarad and his high chancellors.

text:
All creatures able to block Golgari Decoy do so.
Scavenge {3}{G}{G} ({3}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

name: Golgari Germination
text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor: The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.
The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.

text:
Golgari Grave-Troll enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.
Dredge 6 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly six cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Golgari Guildgate
text:
Golgari Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Every part of the gate was reclaimed from forgotten ruins and imbued with new purpose by the Swarm.
Enter those who are starving and sick. You are welcome among the Swarm when the rest of Ravnica rejects you.

text:
{4}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{4}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Golgari Keyrune
text:
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
{B}{G}: Golgari Keyrune becomes a 2/2 black and green Insect artifact creature with deathtouch until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Like a single ant, it only hints at the colony below.
Despite its enormous stature, it can fold itself into a tunnel with startling quickness, vanishing back into the undercity.

name: Golgari Rot Farm
text:
Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield tapped.
When Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

text: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Depending on your point of view, the seal represents a proud guardian of the natural cycle or one who has sold her soul to darkness for eternal life.
Depending on your point of view, the seal represents a proud guardian of the natural cycle or one who has sold her soul to darkness for eternal life.

name: Golgari Thug
text:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Golgothian Sylex
text: {1}, {T}: Each nontoken permanent originally printed in the Antiquities expansion is sacrificed by its controller.

editions.flavor: From their earliest educations, the brothers had known that no human contrivance could stand against the true masters of Dominia.

name: Goliath Beetle
text: Trample

editions.flavor: The balance of nature dictates that one day humans will be stepped on by bugs.

name: Goliath Sphinx
text: Flying

editions.flavor: He makes his home on the tallest mountain in Sejiri, where the vista is as endless as his patience.

name: Goliath Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: The glittering strands of its complex web catch everything from a buzzing gnat to a passing bloatdrake.

name: Gomazoa
text:
Defender, flying
{T}: Put Gomazoa and each creature it's blocking on top of their owners' libraries, then those players shuffle their libraries.

editions.flavor: To explorers, "point man" is a polite way of saying "gomazoa fodder."
To explorers, "point man" is a polite way of saying "gomazoa fodder."

name: Gone
text: Return target creature you don't control to its owner's hand.

name: Gone Missing
text:
Put target permanent on top of its owner's library.
Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes it's best for the lost to stay lost."
—Herzag, mayor of Havengul

name: Gonti, Lord of Luxury
text:
Deathtouch
When Gonti, Lord of Luxury enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of target opponent's library, exile one of them face down, then put the rest on the bottom of that library in a random order. For as long as that card remains exiled, you may look at it, you may cast it, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to cast it.

name: Gonti's Aether Heart
text:
Whenever Gonti's Aether Heart or another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}, Exile Gonti's Aether Heart: Take an extra turn after this one.

editions.flavor: Despite the magic that sustains Gonti's life, the crime lord is often described as heartless.

name: Gonti's Machinations
text:
Whenever you lose life for the first time each turn, you get {E}. (You get an energy counter. Damage causes loss of life.)
Pay {E}{E}, Sacrifice Gonti's Machinations: Each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: "I am confident that all our enterprises can benefit from this little revolution."

name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.

name: Gore-House Chainwalker
text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: If the pig's blood drips on you, you're next on the chain.

"The Mardu are like the gore swine. We are wild, hunt in packs, and rarely clean the blood from our blades."
—Vallash, Mardu warrior

name: Goretusk Firebeast
text: When Goretusk Firebeast enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: As a youth, Kamahl took one for a pet. His hair has yet to grow back.

name: Gore Vassal
text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.

editions.flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—Tome of Machines, verse 1703

name: Gorger Wurm
text: Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: In war-torn Alara, sometimes a wurm's gullet is the safest place to be.

name: Gorgon Flail
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Gorgon Recluse
text:
Whenever Gorgon Recluse blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Madness {B}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Gorgon's Head
text:
Equipped creature has deathtouch.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor:
"You slew the gorgon? Show me."
—King Igalus, last words

name: Gorilla Berserkers
text:
Trample; rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
Gorilla Berserkers can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Their fury is their greatest weapon."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

"Beneath serenity may lie
 a hidden rage."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.

editions.flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

"Oh, no—not you again?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Oh, no—not you again?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

name: Gorilla Pack
text:
Gorilla Pack can't attack unless defending player controls a Forest.
When you control no Forests, sacrifice Gorilla Pack.

editions.flavor:
"We learned this at a dear price: once you cross the great river, get through the Yavimaya forest at top speed."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Gorilla Shaman
text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.

editions.flavor:
"Frankly, destruction is best left to professionals."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"Each generation teaches the next that artifice is the enemy of natural order."

name: Gorilla Titan
text:
Trample
Gorilla Titan gets +4/+4 as long as there are no cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "I want a banana this big!"

name: Gorilla War Cry
text:
Cast Gorilla War Cry only during combat before blockers are declared.
All creatures gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor: "The only ‘art' these beasts possess is the art of noise!" —Jaya Ballard
"Theirs is the art of blood." —Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate
The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.
They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

name: Gossamer Chains
text: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

name: Gossamer Phantasm
text:
Flying
When Gossamer Phantasm becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

editions.flavor:
"Belief matters more than truth. Every moment, belief in imaginary things alters lives while truth sits unnoticed and waits."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

text:
First strike

editions.flavor:

—Zogye, Ojutai mystic

name: Graceful Adept
text: You have no maximum hand size.

editions.flavor:
"When you have mastered my lessons, it will seem as though the whole of the world has opened up to your mind and nothing is beyond your grasp."
—Lady Azami

name: Graceful Antelope
text:
Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)
Whenever Graceful Antelope deals combat damage to a player, you may have target land become a Plains until Graceful Antelope leaves the battlefield.

name: Graceful Cat
text: Whenever Graceful Cat attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Though they are held in high regard as symbols of the god Oketra, cats often lack her sense of solidarity.

name: Graceful Reprieve
text: When target creature dies this turn, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

editions.flavor: "In my moment of death, I had a vision of the world, dark and unwelcoming. I wanted to hide in the deepest meander, but the light pulled me back."

name: Grafdigger's Cage
text:
Creature cards can't enter the battlefield from graveyards or libraries.
Players can't cast cards in graveyards or libraries.

editions.flavor:
"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Graf Harvest
text:
Zombies you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
{3}{B}Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Graf Mole
text: Whenever you sacrifice a Clue, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"Their keen sense of smell draws them to the unnatural. To find one is a boon."
—Veka, hinterland inspector

name: Graf Rats
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you both own and control Graf Rats and a creature named Midnight Scavengers, exile them, then meld them into Chittering Host.

name: Grafted Exoskeleton
